content.question:
An agriculturalist wants to estimate the average time from germination to ripe fruit for a new type of seedless strawberry. From a random sample of <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seedless strawberries of the new type, the mean time from germination to ripe fruit is <math alttext="42.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> days with standard deviation <math alttext="3.6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> days.
Assume all conditions for inference were met. Which of the following is a <math alttext="90" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval for the mean time from germination to ripe fruit for the new type of seedless strawberry?

topic.text: 7.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
